qas.question: In what year did the army start using fixed-wing aircraft?
What year did the U.S. join World War I?
What date did the U.S. intervention in New Mexico end?
What year did the army start the left-wing aircraft?
What year did the Chinese join World War I?
What date did the U.S. intervention in New York end?

context: Starting in <a0_0><b4_0>1910<b4_0/><a0_0/>, the army began acquiring fixed-wing aircraft. In 1910, Mexico was having a civil war, peasant rebels fighting government soldiers. The army was deployed to American towns near the border to ensure safety to lives and property. In 1916, <a1_0><b5_0>Pancho Villa<b5_0/><a1_0/>, a major rebel leader, attacked Columbus, New Mexico, prompting a U.S. intervention in Mexico until <a3_0><b7_0>7 February 1917<b7_0/><a3_0/>. They fought the rebels and the Mexican federal troops until 1918. The United States joined World War I in <a2_0><b6_0>1917<b6_0/><a2_0/> on the side of Britain, France, Russia, Italy and other allies. U.S. troops were sent to the Western Front and were involved in the last offensives that ended the war. With the armistice in November 1918, the army once again decreased its forces.
